New Records: Jackson Chourio's 449-foot homer was the longest by any Brewer this season.
Key Match Events: Mike Yastrzemski hit a two-run homer in the seventh inning to put the San Francisco Giants ahead for good in a 5-4 victory over the Milwaukee Brewers.
Grant McCray homered for the Giants.
Matt Chapman went 3 for 4 with a solo shot.
Blake Perkins made a homer-preventing catch in the fifth inning.
Willy Adames and Jackson Chourio hit towering two-run homers off Giants starter Logan Webb.
Camilo Doval retired Jackson Chourio on a fly to deep center to end a bases-loaded threat in the sixth inning.
Grant McCray caught a long fly from Rhys Hoskins at the center-field warning track to end a rally in the seventh inning.
Ryan Walker earned his fourth save in eight opportunities.
Post-Match Reflections: Grant McCray commented on the importance of winning one-run games as the Giants push for a wild-card spot.
Blake Perkins expressed mixed feelings about his homer-preventing catch, wishing it had meant more in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Milwaukee’s Willy Adames and Jackson Chourio hit towering two-run homers off Giants starter Logan Webb, who hadn't allowed a homer in his last 43 1/3 innings.

Chourio’s 449-foot homer hit just above the 'O' in the 'One Call…That’s All' slogan on a Gruber Law Offices ad on the bottom left corner of the 12,077-square-foot, center-field scoreboard at American Family Field.
The Giants played their fourth straight one-run game, going 2-2 during that stretch.
Others: Giants' LHP Robbie Ray (left hamstring strain) and RHP Jordan Hicks (right shoulder inflammation) went on the 15-day injured list.
The Giants recalled RHPs Austin Warren and Landen Roupp from Triple-A Sacramento.
Brewers' OF Christian Yelich spoke to reporters for the first time since undergoing season-ending back surgery on Aug. 16, expressing optimism about his long-term recovery.
LHP Kyle Harrison (7-5, 4.00 ERA) will pitch for the Giants and RHP Freddy Peralta (8-7, 3.86) will start for the Brewers in the next game of the series.
